head.title: In Quest of Help for the Autistic

hedline.hl1: In Quest of Help for the Autistic

abstract.p: Leslie Rubman letter on May 6 article cites importance of aggressively treaty sensory deficits in autistic students

block.p: There is research in the field of occupational therapy that shows high correlation between sensory deficits and autistic children (front page, May 6). If these sensory deficits are aggressively treated both at school and at home, there may be many more options within a family's community and within the local public schools for the education of a child.

Addressing sensory deficits requires a committed collaboration between parent, teacher, other classroom staff and the occupational therapist. Using this approach does not make it necessary to uproot a family from another country or state.
The writer is an occupational therapist.
